title: [ISSUE WITH REPLAY/RECORDING MAC] Only getting a max of 30 FPS
body: No matter what I do, my framerate is only 30 FPS in replay mode, no matter if I put it uncapped, or anything, even if I record anything from the videos, it becomes choppy. The only way my videos are a bit smooth is if I put 30 FPS on, but now you guys implements that 30 or 60 FPS encoding thing, and either one of those make the recording choppy. Help please.

replies.body: I'm having the same issue as the OP with nothing running in the background. In game I'm getting around 120-80 fps but when I view the replays after the game they stay at 30 fps. Slowing it down from 1.0x to .5x smooths it a bit but slow motion is not what I'd like. Tried changing the settings from 15fps to uncapped and everything in between and everytime I view the replay it stays at 30fps. Won't go higher or lower. I see there has been no follow up to this issue so I'm posting in hopes that I get a reply.

So you're experiencing a bad framerate while **viewing** a replay, or are you just seeing a bad framerate in a *Highlights* that you recorded? Replays are viewed in the client, while Highlights are viewed in most video players or web browsers.
I am getting the 30 FPS when I view the replay, and when I record, it won't be above 30 FPS either. And I already have tried changing every single setting possible.

Do you have a lot of background apps running, especially anything that draws an overlay on League? I'd recommend [**performing a clean boot**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting#wq3) to ensure this isn't being caused by a background application.

Let me know if this helped.
I have nothing running when I play league or watch any replays, I'm 100% sure you can duplicate the problem on Mac OS. Just boot up League on it, and in the replays, you won't get more than 30 FPS.
